Hi St.Ack,

I used the PathScope for that job.

Basically I used the default setting. The fields I
made some changes are,

scope: max-link-hops: 8
       max-trans-hops:1
frontier:max-delay-ms:18000
         max-retries:5
fetch-processor: HTTP: timeout-seconds:900

--- stackarchiveorg <stack@...> wrote:

> --- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, Yan Zhang
> <yzhang_il@...> wrote:
> >
> > I checked the maunual and didn't find the meaning
> of
> > 'P' in the discovery path (crawl.log). 
> 
> 
> See 'Discovery path' in the glossary section of the
> user manual. 'P'
> is for prerequisites (dns or robots).
> 
> 
> > 
> > In terms of "R", will it affect the link depth of
> a
> > crawling job. For example, if I set the depth
> > (max-link-hops) as 8, but I could find the real
> depth
> > might be 9 or 10, or more in the discovery path of
> a
> > crawl.log file. Is it due to "Redirection"?
> 
> It looks like all on the discovery path gets
> counted, at least if you
> are using decidingscope:
>
http://crawler.archive.org/xref/org/archive/crawler/deciderules/TooManyHopsDecideRule.html#74.
>    What scope are you using?  Tell us more about
> your configuration
> and please include examples of overlong discovery
> paths.
> 
> Thanks,
